metadata.dc:description: We describe in this case a disabled patient affectedby mental retardation who was under her mother’s legalguardianship. She had been admitted at hospital in severalmoments as a consequence of hyponatremiaepisodes, with a probable factitious origin. In thispatient we were forced to consider several possible differentialdiagnoses due to the complex interactionbetween somatic, psychiatric and relational aspects,such as organic and pharmacological causes of hyponatremia,shared psychiatric disorder (folie à deux), Munchausensymdrome by proxy, and mother’s delusionaldisorder. This paper aims to describe and analyse eachone of this diagnostic possibilities under the light ofavailable medical evidences and after the exhaustivepsychopathological evaluation of our patient and herfamiliar environment(AU)

metadata.dc:description: Describimos en nuestro caso a una paciente conretraso mental incapacitada legalmente, bajo la tutelalegal de su madre. Había precisado varios ingresos hospitalariospor hiponatremia de probable origen facticio.La compleja interacción entre aspectos somáticos, psiquiátricosy relacionales del caso nos hicieron considerarcomo posibles diagnósticos diferenciales: causasorgánicas y farmacológicas de hiponatremia, deliriocompartido (folie à deux), síndrome de Munchausen porpoderes y un trastorno delirante materno. Este trabajodescribe y analiza cada una de estas posibilidades a laluz de las pruebas médicas disponibles y de la valoraciónpsicopatológica exhaustiva de la paciente y de suentorno familiar(AU)
